title: Vladmir is a hemomancer, not a Vampire. Evelynn is not a succubus, she is a virgin.
body:
Any other misconception about champions?

Edit: I was not joking about Evelynn being a virgin. This is canon fact.

He is actually a god. People worship him and even have a celebratory day where townsfolk roll around the street...

"Disciples of the cult devoted to Rammus demonstrate their unwavering faith in a yearly ceremony by imitating his famous roll and somersaulting through the city in droves. "

Also, one stonemason had a "short conversation" with the wise Rammus and made the decision to make a huge marketplace since he "approved" his actions.

Exactly. Saying "Vlad isn't a vampire" is like saying "Zoe isn't a little girl".

does vlad bite people, turn into a bat, have to be given permission to enter any occupied dwelling, hate garlic, are there any references to holy objects or worship in this game other than the vague "gods" like Illaoi's idol and its master?

a hemomancer is very different from a vampire, though in anime it can be shown that some vampires practice hemomancy.

they decided to give him a similar appearance because that's what you tend to associate blood with, vampires, but it also makes him look like an eccentric mage

Surely you know how myths and legends work? They have multiple versions. Many versions of the vampire myth do not make them afraid of garlic or unable to reflect on mirrors. I am sure you yourself can think, right now, many different interpretations of the vampire concept, that you have seen in media. The sexy vampire, the ugly demonbat vampire, even the vampire as a scientific virus.

Vladimir the hemomancer is one of said variations of the vampire myth. It is actually so evident that there really is no need to point it out.

Just like they might call Warwick a chimera experiment, but he is very clearly the werewolf myth.

Jax was not transformed by the Void. I see that misinformation all the time here. He is most likely a non-human. Malzahar and Kai'sa aside, Void contamination doesn't give super powers or confer longevity. They are 2 anomalies out of millions of victims. The Void unmakes you. It's eating away at Kassadin and his deterioration is only slowed by the contraptions he wears.

Vel'Koz isn't a Watcher, but thankfully that misconception should pretty much be gone with his lore update.

Ryze didn't fight a Watcher in the Call to Power cinematic. The creature in the ice was a Voidborn sent by the Watchers.

And though it isn't related to a specific champion I see this one occasionally; the demons of Runeterra are not defined by the Christian seven deadly sins. "Evelynn = Lust, Tahm Kench = Gluttony", etc.
We should hang out more.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

I pretty much have your and warghbobo's post histories bookmarked

Wait doesnt the void somehow warp the skin color of the people that are deeply "contaminated" by it?  Jax and kassadin both seem to represent this.


And in Jax´s story "none shall pass" he wears a mask and heavy robes to mask his appearance, one who saw him calls him a monster but in the story about Icathia the soldiers think that the Shurimian soldiers are normal but the ascended are freaks......this applies a great degree of similarity in appearances between their sides. 
'
Furthermore Jax was supposed to be a tall bald giant of a.....person with a beard and skin with marks of old disease, now he appears positively average in height and his skin is purple.

Again they cant have been far from the Shurimian standards given that they felt the other sides soldiers were normal while only the ascended were freakish. 

Kassadin went from normal desert man to blue/purple man who is being eaten by void.


And you are telling me that the void doesnt transform those who are overly exposed to it? 

The heck did those two do to themselves? Create magical paint and pour it over themselves?

The Void does not corrupt, it consumes.

Jax is not tainted by the Void, he _escaped_ it. Kassadin is... well, he's got a lot of weird and wonderful magical stuff that he doesn't fully understand, and that might be drawing the Void to him in unexpected ways. It's just as likely his gear that is tainting his flesh.

So you´re telling me that the skin color of the native icathians is a blue/purple-ish one?

Alright then O_O

Jax is definitely not human. However, there were humans in Icathia.

I can't think of any nation/faction/region in Runeterra composed only of one species... but perhaps Icathia just didn't judge people by their appearance?

Whats happening to malzahar and that one merman vastaya from namis story/comic? They sure look pretty void corrupted and they both seem to be taking some weird void prophet role.

Plus the darkin, metaphorically or not, seem affected at least mentally by the void
Indeed! Mental affliction after facing the Void is definitely something we'll see more of...
I really don't like that last misconception and I see it all too oftne.

To be fair, Riot has an easy way to dispel it: release more lore about more demons.

'cause you can't blame people for jumping to conclusions when we have only 2 Demons and they map properly with Christian sins.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AE99MKef,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2018-10-31T03:38:12.587+0000)

Same with Jax misconception don't blame anyone for believing what they will when Riot drops the ball on updating the lore.

Actually, you can't blame others for believing in the last one. So far there is only 4 confirmed demon entities and they line up perfectly with the Seven Deadly Sins:

Nocturne - Sloth (pretty straightforward keeping in mind his new lore) 
Fiddlestick - Greed (again, his lore is self-explanatory) 
Evelynn - Lust
Tham Kench - Gluttony

If you'd like to bust this misconception you need more demon champions, who actually go against this scheme. So, as long as every demon champion line up perfectly with the Seven Deadly Sins thematics you can't blame others for believing in it.

Next common misconception:
Fiddlesticks isn't a demon.

Also, Tahm and Eve are self-explanatory. Nocturne supposedly representing sloth and Fiddle representing greed are definitely not.

Next misconception. Tahm doesn't represent gluttony, he represents _desire_.

He talks about hunger, but it's almost entirely metaphorical, the hungers of the human heart, an emptiness in the soul that will never be filled. He enables your worst inhibitions and feasts on your despair when you follow them to rock bottom.

He isn't scarfing that last hamburger, he's the voice in your head telling you "just 1 more game" even though its allready 3am and you have to get to work by 8.

While you have a point about the 7 deadly sins, what about {{champion:82}}/{{champion:120}}/{{champion:30}} and {{champion:412}} referencing the 4 horsemen of the apocalypse?  I thought that was a thing.
Not a thing either.
I think that Tham is more Greed than Gluttony if you read his lore.
